body_content.explanation: the act of selling newspaper or magazine articles, photographs, television shows, etc. to other organizations so that they can be published or shown in several places, or an instance of this:
examples: The series, created in the late 1990s, first ran in syndication (= having been sold to other organizations) in 2010.
Through television, book club deals, and other syndications, the publishers got their money back.

body_content.explanation: the act of giving a debt or loan to a group of people or organizations so they can control or manage it, or an instance of this:
examples: They have put the debt syndication on hold until markets have stabilized.
The company has launched the syndication of a loan of up to $3 billion.
